qas.question: what is a key aspect of the gates foundation in the US

answers.text: A key aspect of the Gates Foundation's U.S. efforts involves an overhaul of the country's education policies at both the K-12 and college levels
including support for teacher evaluations and charter schools and opposition to seniority-based layoffs

qas.question: how much did it spend in 2009

answers.text: It spent $373 million on education in 2009.

qas.question: It was an early backer of what

answers.text: The foundation was the biggest early backer of the Common Core State Standards Initiative.

qas.question: How much did teachers' unions spend on education in 2009?

plausible_answers.text: an overhaul of the country's education policies at both the K-12 and college levels

qas.question: What is a key aspect of the Common Core State Standards U.S. efforts?
What group has donated to the two largest national charter schools?
What did the Gates foundation spend on support for teacher evaluations in 2009?
What were teachers' unions the biggest early backer of?

context: <a0_0>A key aspect of <b6_0>the Gates Foundation<b6_0/>'s U.S. efforts involves <b5_0>an overhaul of the country's education policies at both the K-12 and college levels<b5_0/><a0_0/>, <a1_0>including support for teacher evaluations and charter schools and opposition to seniority-based layoffs<a1_0/> and other aspects of the education system that are typically backed by teachers' unions. <a2_0>It spent <b4_0><b7_0>$373 million<b7_0/><b4_0/> on education in 2009.<a2_0/> It has also donated to the two largest national teachers' unions. <a3_0>The foundation was the biggest early backer of the <b8_0>Common Core State Standards Initiative<b8_0/>.
